poem:
Brand Destruction

In the morning fog of headlines,  
a spark ignites—rich voices,  
Tesla's hum quieted by a lurching Doge,  
the empire crumbles not with a crash,  
but a tweet.  
An advisor's whim,  
the electrified road now murky,  
misstep in a billionaire's dance—  
greatest, they say,  
as if ruins aren't everywhere.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Expert calls Musk’s ‘Doge’ involvement ‘one of the greatest brand destructions’ The prominent US marketing professor Scott Galloway says Elon Musk’s decision to implement brutal job and spending cuts within the federal government on behalf of the Trump administration was “one of the greatest brand destructions” ever. Speaking on Friday’s episode of the popular Pivot podcast, which he co-hosts, Galloway said Trump’s billionaire businessman adviser alienated the customer base of his electrical vehicle manufacturer Tesla". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
